Dr. Toast Live @ California Academy of Sciences

posted April 9, 2009 | music, shows

Thursday, April 9, 2009, 6pm-10pm - Dr. Toast presents a fascinating lecture on the current state of Toastronomical Science at the California Academy of Sciences in Golden Gate Park, San Francisco. Well, either that, or he's spinning his toasty beats there for the 3rd annual Yuri's Night Bay Area as part of the Academy's NightLife series. Celebrate the anniversary of the first human spaceflight with music from Dr. Toast, Nalepa, Random Rab, and Cumulus, explore the indoor rain forest and Morrison Planetarium, hear lectures from visiting NASA scientists, and enjoy ambient soundscapes in the Steinhart Aquarium.


Dr. Toast Live @ Transported

posted April 2, 2009 | music, shows

Thursday, April 2, 2009, 8:30pm - False Profit, LLC takes over the Transported bus for an evening with selectors benchun, Obi-J, and Dr. Toast. Pick-up spot: The Bus Stop Gallery (135 Dore Street, Unit C, San Francisco). Tickets available at Brown Paper Tickets.

The Brunch

posted February 6, 2009 | toast-links

I think this is an art project, but I'm not totally sure. It's a celebration of the neurotic attention to precision that we sometimes lack in our brunch ritual. Shown below: "002 |12.3 mm , tool for precise bread slicing"


Social Networking for your Toaster

posted December 21, 2008 | toasters

An enterprising young gentleman from Pittsburgh named Hans Scharler has connected his toaster to Twitter. Now you can get realtime updates of its toasting endeavors on its Twitter page. Hans connected his toaster to an ioBridge module, which allows it to send realitime email updates to its Twitter account whenever toasting starts or stops. He blogs about the project on his site, and has posted a slideshow on Instructables.



Dr. Toast Live on the Transported Bus

posted December 21, 2008 | music, shows

This important message from TransportedSF: "Decompress from New Year's Eve with the TransportedSF bus crew. On Thursday, January 8th, we'll be having an intimate chill night with musical masterminds Dr. Toast & F'kir. The bus will be tricked out with extra plush cushions and lounge areas. We meet at The Bus Stop Gallery, 135 Dore St, Unit C at 7:30pm for check-in and we return you at 11:30pm. Tickets are $20 and can be purchased through our web site: http://www.transportedsf.com . We hope you can join us!"



Dr. Toast Live @ Cubik and Origami Record Release

posted October 30, 2008 | music, shows

Saturday, November 8, 2008, 10pm until later - "Come join Cubik and Origami on Saturday, November 8 as they celebrate the release of Slept in on Doomsday, their new album on Dinner Party Records. They'll be playing along with some other great live acts and DJs. Expect a night of top-notch downtempo, midtempo, IDM, electro, dubstep and more. Featuring: Cubik and Origami - Live (Dinner Party) - Dr. Toast - Live (False Profit) - Comma - Live (Slidecamp) - Red Stickman (Ambient Mafia) - L'Aural and Daps - DJ set with live violin (Langton) - Shawn Allen (Dinner Party). They'll have their new album available, as well as some fresh merchandise. Those who come best dressed for Doomsday will receive special gift packs! Where: Langton Labs - #9 Langton, San Francisco [map]. Free!"



Dr. Toast Live @ FWR

posted October 30, 2008 | music, shows

Thursday, October 30, 2008 - Fashion With Responsibility is an event bringing together San Francisco clothing designers who embrace the ideals of fair trade, organic sustainability, and an end to sweatshop conditions. This free designer trunk show runs from 4pm until 1am, and Dr. Toast performs at 8:30. 111 Minna Gallery, San Francisco. [map]


Dr. Toast Live @ End of an Error

posted October 30, 2008 | music, shows

Tuesday, November 4th, 2008 - EvilBreaks says: "Come join us at Mighty where we'll be broadcasting the election coverage throughout the club with a soundtrack provided by a bunch of amazing artists who just can't help but celebrate the fact that there really is a light at the end of the tunnel, and yes, it's changing colors. In the back room we'll have some food & snacks as well as a couple televisions setup in a more relaxing environment so that the more serious voter can catch all the election info as it comes in. Outside, Peter (TeacherWiththeBus.com) will be bringing down his awesome bus with the dance-floor & the Ambient Mafia will be providing the music, visuals, & who knows what else. In the main room, music will be provided by a couple SF dj's that I'm sure most of you know, as well as a couple that you probably should know. We also might even have a special, super secret, can't tell you yet, out-of-town dj stop in to play, but I guess you'll just have to come to find out." Mighty, 119 Utah St., San Francisco [map] $5, free before 11pm with proof that you voted, sticker or stub. 9pm - 2am



Toast is Better Without Garfield

posted October 13, 2008 | toast-links, toasters

The brilliant Garfield Minus Garfield features classic Garfield cartoons that have been edited to remove the feline protagonist. The results are fascinating and wonderful, as you can see in the panel below.

Cute, bulldog, toast

posted October 9, 2008 | toast-links, toasters

Artist Joe Alterio has a project called Robots and Monsters, wherein he will create an illustrated robot or monster based on the three words you provide him. He then donates his $50 fee to the EFF ("like ACLU with computers"), and you get to keep the picture. Here's one of my favorites: "Cute, bulldog, toast". You can view the whole menagerie on Flickr.
